title: More Pings!
body:
This may or may not have made it onto the forums before, so if it has I apologize--but I think this would be really  helpful, once you got the feel for where the new pings were!! What do y'all think?

https://fbcdn-sphotos-d-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xap1/v/t1.0-9/10603560_10202189066401101_7054475251373390056_n.jpg?oh=791aac906605efb22eefd6d434953374&oe=54A65E36&__gda__=1419948643_31c79f9905ec0ca15984062f67b752c6

replies.body:
During the development of the radial menu, it become pretty clear that many people had issues with any more than 4. You couldn't reliably hit the action you want and describing the motion became difficult.

I also fear that this is taking advantage of the menu in ways that could better fit in a different form.
The ping wheel offers quick communication and **positional** communication. It's also a pretty big stick at the problem space it's solving.

A different direction to look at this is:
What if there was a different way of using chat to quickly communicate these other ideas? Does placing it on the radial menu offer any benefits over that route?
What if there was just a binding that let you communicate some of these ideas in a directional manner? One neat idea that other MOBA games have done is being able to modifier + click on an ability to post the cooldown of it into chat.


Fo' reals though:
We've poked at different ideas before (in experimentation, not anything that can be player delivered), and there's definitely a lot of great opportunities here. I don't think anyone is looking at the problem space at the moment however.
So you don't think that we need a "Warded" ping? I'd love one of those; it's a painintheass to type it out all the time when you should be dodging skillshots as a support.

Oops! Most of my post was focused at the "Ult up in..." (mainly).

I actually like "Warded", it's very positional, very informative, and difficult to describe in current tools. It's exactly the type of problem that the radial menu would be perfect to solve.

For that I think the issue there is more "Where do we put this?". Which is solvable (Another radial menu perhaps?).
If a team looks at the problemspace in more depth, I think that'll be the real difficulty, thinking out in the blue.

you -could- just get rid of the redundant "caution" ping at the top of the dial. Honestly, I see no difference between that and the yellow back ping. Especially since it's used in almost the same situations and for the same reasons as the yellow ping.

That's a consideration that's been passed around quite a bit.
My worry there is that of familiarity.

Anecdotal case: When we were first developing the radial menu, the left and right were actually swapped.
We actually had it internally for nearly 9 months before we released it IIRC (the team prioritized the then new HUD and the item shop above the radial menu so it got set aside for awhile). That's a LOT of time to get familiar to something in play behavior.

Even now, personally, I will accidentally ping as though it was what it used to be because the menu optimized around muscle memory. We flipped it for good reasons, but it's still quite disruptive as an individual.

That's a type of disruption I would rather avoid if possible for other players. Again, muscle memory is super significant here.


That said, a few of us have played with the idea of other types of ping as well. Establishing a different input behavior rather than replacing an existing one could open us up to do more. (And it means we don't let  you guys sink in to the muscle memory case in the replacement version).

With all respect, that sounds like you're saying that you are sticking with a functionless button because making it useful would take time to get used to. Caution doesn't really serve a purpose, and I see multiple games go by without anyone ever using the caution ping, and I can't say the same of the others. It really doesn't give us any unique communication. Replacing it with something that would give us unique communication would be highly preferable.

Also, it's worth remembering that the muscle memory wouldn't be that big of a concern, because there isn't ever going to be a time where I'm trying to reach for the caution command and then panicking when I find it missing. There isn't much habit to overcome for an unused command.

It was more a *cautionary* point. It's definitely NOT a reason to not do it.
It's more like "I would like to check on this first".

There are tools available like "Let's see how often the caution ping gets used in relation to other pings" that we could use to validate that one way or another. (Though, it'd take a bit of time to gather that data)

If it turns out to be an invalid concern, then sure, wasted UI is just annoying and it deserves to be replaced.
Again though, that's still kind of up to the team that ends up looking at it.

what about a custom menu, you still got 4 type of ping, but you can chose during (or before the game) the game what ping you want in a pool of 6/7 possibilities.

For exemple, an "on my way" for a support is most likely never used, so switch it for a "warded here" would be better
Same for ennemy missing for the jungler who can be easily switch for another type of ping

Reinbloom what about doing like you said and making 2 Radial pings and they are based on if you hold ctrl or Alt?

Like how when you do the classic yellow ping it is Ctrl? and the green ping is Alt? Have all the "positive" pings on one of the radials and all the negatives on another? That way we can have 8 radial pings without too much complexity being added because you have the 2 keys that alot of leaguers should be used to by now. 

So you could have maybe "Engaging" "Assist Me" "On My way" and I can't think of another one so possibly a "Ward Here" ping? 

Then "Danger" "Enemy Missing" "Warded" no idea what the 4th could be.

I like that idea personally. We've tested it internally to pretty positive reaction.

I'm actually interested in seeing if I can open up this discussion more in a couple days. There's quite a few good ideas here (not just this post).

I'm going to try to get more information on which team this will fall under and when it's sensible for resources to exist for this to be a thing (note: that doesn't mean "working on it", but figuring out who's backlog it sits in kind of deal).

Question for you all:
What would you think about "We need vision here" / "Enemy has vision here" pings instead of ward specific? I'm curious because the generality keeps it open to more maps and modes (sorrrrrt of) and even more general design decisions we could take in the future. Basically, plays into other definitely nefarious plans.

Love the idea of "vision" rather than specifically wards. Especially since, if some day Riot buffs Clairvoyance/Blue Trinket, you can use that to ping someone to use the trinket there.

Other than that, I love that idea.
Sounds alright.
I think that's sufficient. Might lead to people blowing their Blue Trinket when you wanted a ward, but that's a fairly minor problem.

Why don't we leave current Smart Ping as it is on one button (G), and leave, for example, the other ping array on another (V)? Right now both of them are the exact same. So from top-right-bottom-left on G would be Danger, On My Way, Assist me, and Missing. For V, top-right-bottom-left would be "Ward Here Please" (for allies), "Warded here" (enemy vision here), and then I was thinking that the left/bottom would be one entire half dedicated to item-interactive pings (up to seven item slots placed them depending on how many actives you have + trinket). So you would drag the ping to the bottom half towards the icon of your item (which will show up on the ping if you bought it), which would say in chat, for example "<player>'s Deathfire Grasp has 60 seconds left on its cooldown! or "<player>'s Deathfire Grasp is coming up soon with 15 seconds left on its cooldown!" or "<player>'s Deathfire Grasp is ready and available for use!".

http://puu.sh/brEiN/6c1c2260de.png
Sorry for bad art

Situations you use "caution" pings are quite similar to yellow pings. 

There are two main use of yellow ping:

- enemy myssing
- "get the hell out of there"

The "caution" ping just say that there is generally danger meaning that there is or there might be enemies nearby. This uncertainity of "caution" ping leads to palyers ignoring it.

But yellow ping is more forceful and radiates more confidence. So there is less posibility that players will ignore it.

Just my thoughts.
I yearn for "warded" ping. It would save a jungler a lot of time.

I personally also like the 4 option dial now, but what if the icon and floating text above the ward (in view) could be customized? I've seen versions of this idea tossed around, and I like the idea of me being able to customize my own ping types. I only use flash down and/or ult (regular ping), danger, warded (regular ping), missing, and on my way. It's a solid idea. Leave them as they are as default and for those that like the default, but also allow customization to the pings would solve the problem entirely... IMHO.

Not sure if your still checking this. If you are I think I have a good solution. 

Create two radial menus. The current one remains as is as it is about champion movement and threats and leave that default bound to g.

Then bound to maybe v a second radial menu that contains pings like warded, ward here, summoners down, ult down things not tied to champion movement.

Would love to see this in game

This just doesn't really seem valid. Back, oh gosh idk how long ago it was, {{champion:31}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:1}} 's W skills were all changed from free floating triangle to anchored on character, and so many people wanted it to be optional and the response we got was, essentially, "get used to it." Well we all did. Muscle memory be damned, we adjusted.

My only input is that a "warded" ping would be best with a chat log message for time-stamp purposes, but maybe that's OP.
All the pings do have chat messages and you can just turn on timestamps and you will also know when it was said/pinged then

I basically only ever use the yellow "back" ping (mapped to V) right before I type into chat that there is a ward wherever I just pinged. Occasionally I'll use it on a teammate to warn them, specifially, to come back and not extend/chase any further.

I think that's really the only feedback I have. I would replace the red "danger" ping (currently at the top of the radial menu) with a "warded" ping. Everything else I think is by and large fine; if someone blows their ult or escape it's usually during a skirmish, after which time I usually either have time to back off and type things, or am dead and have time to type things, so I don't think that's really necessary. Similarly, letting people know the cooldown on your own ult can happen with minimal difficulty in chat, though I do like the idea of being able to hit a modifier key, then click the ability icon or hit the ability key, so that could be worth exploring. "Assist me" is the only other one I could possibly consider worth replacing, as currently you can hit G and click a turret to request assistance (or target, if it's an enemy turret). But I don't think that's so redundant as to warrant replacing the ping, since sometimes you can't click the turret (like if you're overextended, or some such).

**Tl;dr: replace the red "danger" ping with a "this is warded" ping. Wards are in a much more rapid state of flux than abilities, making it more difficult to type the warnings into chat. Otherwise I think everything is pretty functional.**

Disclaimer: This is only my opinion as it pertains to my experiences. I'm not claiming to speak for anyone else.
Would it be feasible to have a customizable radial menu? Could throw it on the front of the menu with all the smartcast/binding options, that way people can put them wherever it makes sense to them.

I'm not really sure why you consider the caution ping useless; it's loud, its red, and in my mind its a really clear indicator that 'you really shouldn't be doing whatever you're doing'. I've definitely saved a few lives with spam of caution pings... even if most people just do it to tell other players to get away from waves of creeps or jungle camps they want to farm.
yellow ping woulda done the same job in those situations.

I think you could add 'warded' to the radial menu for 5 points. 5 points worked in Crysis imo.

I agree any more is just making the menu super messy (especially 'ult in' :S ).

Not sure which post of yours to respond to, but there is an option you kinda hit on but didn't give much outright though to.  This is to break them into two dials.  For example you can look at it as an actionary dial and a cautionary dial.  The actionary dial could be used for communications that require action, for example the actions could be "On my way", "Go in on enemy", "Need assistance", and "Ward here, plz".  Whereas the cautionary dial could be more along the lines of, "Be careful", "Enemies incoming", "Enemies Missing", and "It is warded".

Some of these are just placeholders because I put the post together quickly but some of them I have been wanting for a long time now.  The main one I would like to see is the "Enemies Incoming" ping because there have been times when I have been ganked by the jungler then they leave and I know they are going mid or top or whatever but when I ping caution or enemies missing the other laner sees that my lane enemy is still in lane and disregards my ping.  This becomes very frustrating.  Another situation that I run into that this would be great for is when you run into a fight where you are outnumbered and know you can win, like I run into a lot with trundle, an ally pings caution because they don't think you can win a 2v1 then part way through a third shows up and you lose the fight.  Being able to differentiate between "be careful" and "enemies incoming" would be a great help for scenerios like this.  

The "warded" ping is one that would be helpful in it's own right but I don't think I need to defend this argument because of the fact that many can already see the benefits of this.  

The "Go In" ping would also be helpful because of being able to tell your allies to engage on someone other than pinging "on my way" or "target XX".  This is especially true when playing someone with a stealth or teleport of some kind because you don't mistime your abilities because the ally had to differentiate between whether you mean to target them when you get there or whether you are porting or running.  They would be able to see "go in" and be able to start the fight right off.

"Ward here, plz" is self explanatory, though probably not a necessity.

I'm not using radial menu, only keybinds. Could we get more pings accessible via just keybinds perhaps?

- Warded
- Need ward there
- Deward that
- Retreat
It might be interesting if that had an alternate function on Twisted Treeline/the Crystal Scar/Howling Abyss.

What about an autocorrect style quick chat. 

For instance: you type "w" and "arded" appears in ghost letters. Keep typing, it disappears, but hit enter now and you say Warded with one key press without having to move your hand from your important keys.

I've been listening to these ping threads for quite some time now, and I have a few minor suggestions from the information I've gathered.

A new ping system would take time to get used to, but it would benefit people more in the long run than it would hamper early on.

I think it should be "G" for the original 4 pings, and "V" For new pings that people want to introduce, such as ward, ult up, enemy ult down, or enemy escape down. There could be other options, but for people that feel they dont need it, just continue pressing G. For the people that want the new pings, you can now press V.

I'm going to take a stab at the ping wheel, the same one I have taken before.

Two ping wheels is better than one. We have two basic pings, green and red iirc. Have each ping type have its own wheel corresponding to threat and assistance.

Its so simple it is beyond me why it wasn't implemented like this in the first place.

Why not have a seperate radial for alt-click. That way we have two different radials! duoradials! Radialtastic! It'd be a wise choice, indeed. {{champion:74}} 

For the second radial I would like a good job button, ward button, and maybe a countdown button?

What about a second modifier click to bring up a different set of 4 options, if 4 is the holy grail. So maybe Smart ping is bound to ctrl and g, while the "advanced ping," or whatever you want to call it, bound to alt and v.

You could try having another menu on Ctrl. And be able to rebind that or maybe toggle the menus between Ctrl and Alt and be separate from the pings themselves since some people might want the new menu on Alt but still want the normal ping on Alt.

Agreed; there needs to just be one 4-option radial menu for the primary ping button. The options should essentially work like a simple 2x2 grid: "Me" and "(A) Teammate(s)" on one axis, with "Avoid That" and "Go(ing) There" on the other.

From a different perspective, imagine all the music we could make with more pings.
{{champion:37}}

The only additional pings I want are **"Warded"** and **"Place a Ward Here"**. I'm a support main, and more than once I've died, or let someone else die because I was frantically trying to type out "Jungler there's a ward there don't go in!", especially when the jungler doesn't use the "On my way" ping to let us know he's not just coming down for the Golems. Plenty of options for space on a ctrl-R.click radial and ctrl-L.click radial.

One other thing, I have Ctrl-R.click to do the **Quick Alert Ping** (Target or Request Aid) while Ctrl.L-click is **Quick Retreat Ping** (Fall Back or Be Careful). Obviously holding it down opens the radial, but using Ctrl-R.click for Quick Alert forces me to move, same as if I had simply Right Clicked. I do *NOT* want to move, but I *DO* want to be able to use both mouse buttons for quick pings.
I'm ashamed to admit that I've done the same thing. It happens, especially before you get a sightstone and sweeper. :(

Oll right, so now weve got 6 pings basically. Two standard retreat and 'pointer' with just mouse click + key modifier and radial menu with 4 pings. That means we have one 'negative' and one 'positive' key modifier for a normal mouse click when it comes to ping. Why not elaborate on this idea and create two separate wheels with 4 pings on them?
One of the wheels would be 'enemy related' and the second one would be 'ally related'. This is a simple and logical concept and we need to use simple and understandable ideas when it comes to UI.

This is the basic idea: http://imgur.com/2RE2eIc

So now we have 8 options.
Let's start with getting rid of the 'caution' ping to which I, ofr this day, could not find any purpose honestly. :P
Put it on the enemy wheel and make it "enemy spotted" ping (with MGS-like sound! :D). Now we've got something useful, even without changing the icon. It would help in tracking enemy jungler and in the mid-late game informed about enemy movement on the map without being 'in your face' like the orange "GET THE HELL OUT' ping is. 
Oh do I smell improvement here? 
Let's leave the 'missing' ping. It's good.
Now we need two more. Lets go for the most requested ones, like 'warded' and 'no escapes'. I think these are the most typed interactions with the junglers in my opinion. We need to make them simplier and quicker for sure. This would also let laners inform thej jungler in advance of any wards placed and escapes down, improving overall map awareness.

Now we have the enemy ping wheel complete. Moving on to the ally ping wheel.

"On my way" and "Assist me" are useful pings imho and theres no need to replace them. 
What can we do to fill these two empty spaces in though?
My idea is to go for "cooldowns down". It would hover over a life bar of your character for a second letting the ally (suppeort, jungler, anyone) know that you arre not ready to engage yet, so they need to wait a bit. This is my choice as that kind of things need to be typer out quickly and pings let you do it in a blink of an eye.
The last spot would be then filled with requested 'Please ward here'. Lane wards, dragon, baron, crucial areas. They need to be warded and players often foget about this. Let's have it a quick way.

Also, some improvent may be done in terms of placing it on the wheel, althout it would require to move the existing pings placement from the places they take now on the single wheel and moveing them over, causing some issues with muscle momeory for some time. Like, ward pings 'warded' and 'place ward here' may be both in the same place on the 'enemy wheel' and 'ally wheel' and so on, to make things a bit more logical.

Let's not forget about sounds as well. For me, most of the sounds are ok, but the 'caution' one is... strange. I dont have any feelings related to it actually, maybe because it is used so rarely.
On the other hand, "Get away" standard ping is getting into my soul and under my nails anytime it is spammed. Like my brain being electrocuted. 

anyway. What do you think of the double wheel idea? It will not neccessarily caouse confusion with too many pings as long as they are logically placed and implemented in my opinion and 10 of them is the amount that maybe breaching the simplicity barrier, but does not compromise so much on the informative side of things. Which is the compromise to be taken at some point. Along with timers I think it can greatly improve the UI of LoL and eliminate the need of using the chat to communicate in situations where every second counts.

Worgslarg, I agree with u that it might be a little cluttered--it could definitely be shifted around and edited to make it more optimal, but I would also rly love to see more ping choices. Pings are so important, I prefer ppl to ping over alert me through chat.. I pay more attention to pings anyway
Especially when typing something out in chat is the best way to die.
Make 2 ping wheels with 2 different hotkeys

I think there's definitely more map-contextual communication that could be added in additional pings (pinging a time on a spot on the map, for example). I also think any more than four swipe-directions per wheel will make it harder to utilize efficiently and effectively. But right now, you've got two buttons bound to basic pings that both open the same ping wheel. Other games have made good use of 'z' 'x' and 'c' for fast communication (I'm thinking TF2's dialogue menus specifically) and think you could probably get up to 3 wheels out of them or other configurations, without heavily impacting muscle reflex or mental load.

Hi guys,

I think the ping "Assist me" is better like here it is now because when i use this ping, i "Put my flag down", so i think it's more realist.

whats the difference between **DANGER **and **RETREAD**?
why is there no **ATTACK **option
**enemy marked **=\= **attack enemy**

what about being able to ping the potential ward placed by enemy team, something that stays on the minimap  for 2-3 minutes, so that way we can warn our teammates about the dangerous areas that they are coming and going into. I understand that people can also abuse this, but if you make it so one player can only ping 1-2 ward spots, then it encourages team work and giving that information (right or wrong information) is valuable to multiple players. also adding special ping notices to dragons/baron/towers that last would mean people can priotize certain things easiar, like say 4 people ping baron then everyone would know the gameplan and what everyone wants

what about being able to ping the potential ward placed by enemy team, something that stays on the minimap  for 2-3 minutes, so that way we can warn our teammates about the dangerous areas that they are coming and going into. I understand that people can also abuse this, but if you make it so one player can only ping 1-2 ward spots, then it encourages team work and giving that information (right or wrong information) is valuable to multiple players. also adding special ping notices to dragons/baron/towers that last would mean people can priotize certain things easiar, like say 4 people ping baron then everyone would know the gameplan and what everyone wants

Riot, come on, really? All you have to do is put a 2nd page of 4 pings on the other key, ctrl for one, alt for the other. Have one be one category of things, such as the current ones, and the other be another category of additional but less critical information to communicate, such as ward locations and other things. This isn't rocket scence, just put a 2nd page on the other key - and keep the ctrl alert ping working as it does. Also, make the "mia" ping louder, the first sound back when smart ping was first added, was way better than the current sound, which you can barely hear and has no sense of immediacy. No one noticies it unless it is spammed, and if a fight or engagement is happening, no one notices it at all.
and that got ignored http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4683975

We need more pings for sure, at least a Warded ping. But you can't change the directions of the classic pings.

Kinda sad to see a Rioter just trying to BS around the topic, reminds me of how they reply whenever someone talks about the all too neccessary 4th ban per team in draft.
At least put the Wareded Ping. Thats the one that i consider most important, me  being a jungler espcially.
